channel.title: Anti-Jagex uploading site/program [in-progress]
channel.description:
Jagex keeps reporting links source+client here on the DL section if you haven't already noticed.
Example: https://www.dropbox.com/s/5upmjbvps0aa11i/niggascape%20source%20and%20client.rar
Making a program + website that they cannot take down.
Let me know who will use it, will be release tmm. (nov.3.2012)
Give me ideas for it to work on tonight, for example, JAVA editor, Jar compressor, etc.
Thanks guys, -RuneFate

item.title: Anti-Jagex uploading site/program [in-progress]
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

drubrkletern:

Well the tos thing doesn’t have any legal power, afaik from discussions in other threads a while back

The only time it comes into play is if Jagex rages at mopar for supporting private servers from my knowledge, so that’s as good as reason as any to stay off it, though I think they’ve started ignoring private servers as I haven’t seen any website taken down recently.

Read full topic

item.title: Anti-Jagex uploading site/program [in-progress]
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

I highly doubt they’re taking them down to be perfectly honest, mostly because most of the links on other threads work just fine. More than likely the OP removed it, it happens allot, especially with dropbox.

You also can’t stop Jagex from taking it down. For one thing, they can’t touch the source, as they were written by the community alone, none of their content is theirs. Also, how would they find the links if they aren’t legally allowed to view this site? Did you not read the TOS page on your first visit?

Plus, you don’t seem to understand that hosting large files (such as the cache) would take loads of bandwidth. Every time someone downloads a 100mb cache, that’s a good portion of your bandwidth gone. So unless you have a decent sized dedicated server with high up/download spreads and 1tb+ Bandwidth, it wouldn’t help.

Read full topic
